Detailed Description

Primary API description for Scaleable Polyphonic MIDI Engine

Author:
Phil Burk, Copyright 2002 Mobileer, PROPRIETARY and CONFIDENTIAL

Define Documentation

#define SPMIDI_DEFAULT_MASTER_VOLUME   (0x80)
 

Default volume for SPMIDI_SetMasterVolume.

#define SPMIDI_MAX_FRAMES_PER_BUFFER   (256)
 

Maximum number of frames that an SPMIDI synth can calculate in one burst.

The actual number may be lower, and can be queried by calling SPMIDI_GetFramesPerBuffer()

#define SPMIDI_TEST_BANK   (((0x70)<<8) | 0x00)
 

When General-MIDI mode is OFF, notes received on this bank will be mapped to special test instruments.

The identity of these instruments may change without notice. So don't rely on using this bank.

#define SPMIDI_VEQ_NOMINAL_GAIN   (0x80)
 

Nominal gain for SPMIDI_PARAM_VEQ_BASS_CUTOFF.

Nominal means it is equivalent to 1.0 and will not change the velocity.

#define SPMIDI_VIBRATOR_BANK   (((0x79)<<8) | 0x06)
 

The Scaleable Polyphony standard defines a special bank and program for the mobile telephone vibrator.

This allows a composer to embed commands to trigger the phone vibrator during a song. See SPMIDI_SetVibratorCallback().

#define SPMIDI_VIBRATOR_PROGRAM   (0x7C)

By not requiring one or the other we can optimize this for the platform.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum SPMIDI_Parameter_e
 

These parameters can be used to control various synthesizer values.

Enumeration values:
SPMIDI_PARAM_COMPRESSOR_ON  Set to 1 to enable compressor.

The compressor raises the volume of quiet sections and lowers the volume of overly loud sections. This can increase the perceived loudness of a song. Set to zero to disable the compressor, one to enable it. Default is 1.

SPMIDI_PARAM_COMPRESSOR_CURVE  Determines softness of compressor gain curve.

Values closer to zero result in more extreme compression. Suggested value is 20.

SPMIDI_PARAM_COMPRESSOR_TARGET  Determines target loudness of compressor as a percentage of the maximum volume.

Note that the signal will sometimes exceed the target when a sudden peak occurs. Suggested value is 88.

SPMIDI_PARAM_COMPRESSOR_THRESHOLD  Determines percentage of maximum for threshold.

Signals with an amplitude below the threshold are not compressed. This prevents low level noise from being amplified to extremely loud levels. Suggested value is 2.

SPMIDI_PARAM_VEQ_BASS_CUTOFF  Pitches below this pitch value will have their velocity modified.

The velocity of this pitch will be unchanged. The velocity of pitch zero will be scaled by SPMIDI_PARAM_VEQ_GAIN_AT_ZERO. Intermediate pitches will be scaled using a linearly interpolated gain value. Set this parameter to zero to disable this effect. Suggested cutoff value for mobile phone speakers with poor bass response is 60, which is 261 Hz.

SPMIDI_PARAM_VEQ_GAIN_AT_ZERO  Gain at zero pitch.

Values less than SPMIDI_VEQ_NOMINAL_GAIN will reduce the velocity of low notes Values higher than SPMIDI_VEQ_NOMINAL_GAIN will increase the velocity. You can use a negative value for a more extreme bass reduction. Resulting negative velocities will be clipped to zero so notes below the pitch where the gain function crosses zero will not be heard. Note that a pitch of 24 corresponds to a frequency of 33 Hz, which is below the range of hearing.. Suggested value for mobile phone speakers with poor bass response is (-SPMIDI_VEQ_NOMINAL_GAIN/2)

SPMIDI_PARAM_RHYTHM_VOLUME  Set overall volume of rhythm instruments on the "drum channel" relative to the instruments on other channels.

This volume control is independant of the MasterVolume and the MIDI channel volume controller. This function is normally not called but may be used to make a synthesizer less percussive.

This volume control uses a low resolution value of SPMIDI_DEFAULT_MASTER_VOLUME for unity gain so that the resolution of the audio signal can be preserved. Because of the granularity of this control, we do not recommend using it for continuous control of volume, for example fading in or out, because it can cause zipper noise. The maximum allowable value is SPMIDI_DEFAULT_MASTER_VOLUME so this parameter can only be used to reduce the rhythm channel volume.

Function Documentation

int SPMIDI_CreateContext (  SPMIDI_Context **  spmidiContextPtr,
int  sampleRate
) 
 

Allocate a context that will contain all of the internal data for a synthesizer.

This is used to isolate multiple threads or processes using the SPMIDI system. Subsequent calls to the SPMIDI system will take this context as a parameter. This allows you to synthesize multiple songs at the same time.

Please note that this specific function is not thread safe. If you anticipate separate threads calling this function, then please use a semaphore to prevent simultaneous calls by different threads.

Parameters:
spmidiContextPtr address of variable to receive a pointer to an SPMIDI_Context
sampleRate frame rate in Hertz. Typical values are 22050 or 44100. Must not exceed SPMIDI_MAX_SAMPLE_RATE. Supported rates include: 8000, 11025, 12000, 16000, 22050, 24000, 32000, 44100, 48000, and 96000 Hz.
Warning:
The quality will sound muted with a sampleRate below 20000.
Returns:
Zero or negative error code.
Exceptions:
SPMIDI_Error_OutOfRange sampleRate exceeds SPMIDI_MAX_SAMPLE_RATE
SPMIDI_Error_UnsupportedRate sampleRate not one of the typical rates

int SPMIDI_DeleteContext (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext  ) 
 

Terminate SPMIDI Library.

Please note that this specific function is not thread safe. If you anticipate separate threads calling this function, then please use a semaphore to prevent simultaneous calls by different threads.

Parameters:
spmidiContext context to be terminated, may not be used after this call

int SPMIDI_EstimateMaxAmplitude (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  numFrames,
int  samplesPerFrame
) 
 

Can be used in place of SPMIDI_ReadFrames() to estimates the max amplitude of synthesized audio.

Analysis is performed by running envelopes, voice assignment, and by processing velocity, pan, mix and other controllers. The oscillators and filters are not generated to save time. A frame is one sample for mono, and two samples for stereo.

Parameters:
numFrames Number of frames to be analysed. Recommend a multiple of the value returned by SPMIDI_GetFramesPerBuffer(), or SPMIDI_MAX_FRAMES_PER_BUFFER.
samplesPerFrame May be 1 for mono or 2 for stereo.
Returns:
Estimated max amplitude based on 16 bit signed samples.

int SPMIDI_GetActiveNoteCount (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext  ) 
 

Return the number of notes currently sounding.

A note will continue to sound for a short times after a NoteOff is received.

int SPMIDI_GetBytesPerMessage (  int  command  ) 
 

Return the number of bytes associated with a MIDI command.

For example, a NoteOn would have three bytes, command+pitch+velocity. This information is useful when parsing a MIDI byte stream.

Returns:
number of bytes for message, or 0 if not a legal command.

int SPMIDI_GetChannelActiveNoteCount (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  channelIndex
) 
 

Return the number of notes currently sounding n a given channel.

A note will continue to sound for a short times after a NoteOff is received.

int SPMIDI_GetChannelEnable (  SPMIDI_Context *  context,
int  channelIndex
) 
 

Query whether a channel has been disabled using SPMIDI_SetChannelEnable().

Parameters:
channelIndex Index of the channel starting with zero.
Exceptions:
SPMIDI_Error_IllegalChannel if channelIndex not 0-15
Returns:
1 if channel is enabled, 0 if disabled, or negative error code

int SPMIDI_GetFrameCount (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext  ) 
 

Return number of frames synthesized so far..

int SPMIDI_GetFramesPerBuffer (  void   ) 
 

Return number of frames that are calculated in a single burst.

This determines the smallest time resolution for controlling the synthesizer.

int SPMIDI_GetMaxNoteCount (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext  ) 
 

Return the highest number of notes played simultaneously since reset.

SPMIDI_Parameter  parameterIndex,
int *  valuePtr

Get indexed parameter value for synthesizer.

zero or native error code

int SPMIDI_GetSampleRate (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext  ) 
 

Returns:
Synthesis sample rate passed to SPMIDI_CreateContext().

int SPMIDI_Initialize (  void   ) 
 

Initialize SPMIDI Library.

This should be called before calling any other Mobileer functions. It may be called multiple times without danger.

void SPMIDI_PrintStatus (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext  ) 
 

Print status of MIDI parser and voice allocator.

This is only called when debugging.

int SPMIDI_ReadFrames (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
void *  samples,
int  numFrames,
int  samplesPerFrame,
int  bitsPerSample
) 
 

Synthesize audio data and place it in the *samples array.

Parameters:
samples Pointer to buffer to be filled with synthesized audio data. Data type determined by bytesPerSample parameter.
numFrames Number of frames to be generated and written to the samples buffer. Recommend a multiple of the value returned by SPMIDI_GetFramesPerBuffer(), or SPMIDI_MAX_FRAMES_PER_BUFFER. A frame is one sample for mono, and two samples for stereo.
samplesPerFrame May be 1 for mono or 2 for stereo.
bitsPerSample May be 8-32. Data will be right justified in the word. Eight bit sample will be delivered as unsigned bytes. Samples between 9 and 16 bits will be delivered in a 16 bit signed short. Samples between 17 and 32 bits will be delivered in a 32 bit signed long.
Returns:
Number of frames generated. May be less than numFrames requested if numFrames is not a multiple of SPMIDI_GetFramesPerBuffer(), or:
Exceptions:
SPMIDI_Error_OutOfRange samplesPerFrame value is not 1 or 2
SPMIDI_Error_IllegalSize bitsPerSample is less than 8 or greater than 32

void SPMIDI_ResetMaxNoteCount (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext  ) 
 

Reset the highest number of notes played simultaneously to zero.

Warning:
This is not thread safe and should only be called by the same thread that is parsing the MIDI bytes.

int SPMIDI_SetChannelEnable (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  channelIndex,
int  onOrOff
) 
 

Enable or disable NoteOn events on a channel.

NoteOff events will still be played to prevent stuck notes. All other events will be played as well to maintain the state of track.

Parameters:
channelIndex Index of the channel starting with zero.
onOrOff Zero to disable a channel, non-zero to enable a channel.
Exceptions:
SPMIDI_Error_IllegalChannel if channelIndex not 0-15

int SPMIDI_SetDefaultPolyphony (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  maxNumVoices
) 
 

Set scaleable polyphony tables to reasonable default for the given number of voices.

void SPMIDI_SetMasterVolume (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  masterVolume
) 
 

Set master volume for rendering MIDI.

You can raise the volume as high as you want but the output will start clipping at some point. I would not raise the volume beyond twice the default unity gain.

This volume control uses a low resolution value of SPMIDI_DEFAULT_MASTER_VOLUME for unity gain so that the resolution of the audio signal can be preserved. Because of the granularity of this control, we do not recommend using it for continuous control of volume, for example fading in or out, because it can cause zipper noise.

Parameters:
masterVolume Use a value of SPMIDI_DEFAULT_MASTER_VOLUME for unity gain.

int SPMIDI_SetMaxVoices (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  maxNumVoices
) 
 

Set maximum number of voices that can sound simultaneously.

Parameters:
maxNumVoices Maximum number of simultaneous voices. If set to zero then SPMIDI_MAX_VOICES will be used. The maxNumVoices parameter cannot be set higher than SPMIDI_MAX_VOICES. Default is SPMIDI_MAX_VOICES.
Returns:
New maxNumVoices adjusted to supported range.

int SPMIDI_SetParameter (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
SPMIDI_Parameter  parameterIndex,
int  value
) 
 

Set indexed parameter for synthesizer, for example SPMIDI_PARAM_COMPRESSOR_ON.

Returns:
zero or native error code

int SPMIDI_SetScaleablePolyphony (  const unsigned char *  mipData,
int  numChannels
) 
 

Set channel priorities and Maximum Instantaneous Polyphony as per Scaleable Polyphony MIDI standard.

Parameters:
mipData Sequence of pairs of data { cc vv } { cc vv } etc. where cc is the channel (zero indexed) and vv is the polyphony required to hear that channel.

int SPMIDI_SetVibratorCallback (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
SPMIDI_VibratorCallback *  vibratorCallback,
void *  vibratorUserData
) 
 

Set function to be called when a telephone rings vibrator message is received.

This is defined as an option by the Scaleable Polyphony standard. The vibrator is triggered by playing notes on program 125 on bank 15494. Please call this with a pointer to a function that will turn on the vibrator on a mobile phone. Must be called after SPMIDI_CreateContext() or it will return SPMIDI_Error_NotStarted.

int SPMIDI_Terminate (  void   ) 
 

Terminate SPMIDI Library.

void SPMIDI_Write (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
const unsigned char *  data,
int  numBytes
) 
 

Write a block of bytes to the MIDI parser.

Commands do not have to be aligned to the beginning of the block as long as the overall stream is legal.

void SPMIDI_WriteByte (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  byte
) 
 

Write one MIDI byte to the synthesizer for processing.

This will handle running status.

void SPMIDI_WriteCommand (  SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  command,
int  data1,
int  data2
) 
 

Write a complete channel command to the synthesizer for processing.

Parameters:
command A MIDI command byte consisting of two nibbles, a MIDI command between 0x80 and 0xF0 and a channel from 0x00 to 0x0F.
data1 First data byte.
data2 Second data byte. If the command does not require a second byte then data2 will be ignored.
See also:
MIDI commands listed in midi.h
